title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in Mautic 1.4.1 allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of users for requests that (1) delete email campaigns or (2) delete contacts.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-8874
  • https://github.com/mautic/mautic/issues/3486
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7vvh-xqq4-w777
items.title: [mautic/core] Mautic Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.content_html:
Mautic version 2.11.0 and earlier contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Company's name that can result in denial of service and execution of javascript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000506
  • https://github.com/mautic/mautic/issues/5222
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-358v-cqjc-2pcq
items.title: [mautic/core] Mautic Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability

items.content_html:
Mautic before 3.2.4 is affected by stored XSS. An attacker with permission to manage companies, an application feature, could attack other users, including administrators. For example, by loading an externally crafted JavaScript file, an attacker could eventually perform actions as the target user. These actions include changing the user passwords, altering user or email addresses, or adding a new administrator to the system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-35128
  • https://forum.mautic.org/c/announcements/16
  • https://forum.mautic.org/t/security-release-for-all-versions-of-mautic-prior-to-2-16-5-and-3-2-4/17786
  • https://labs.bishopfox.com/advisories/mautic-version-3.2.2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-98j2-3jv7-274m
items.title: [mautic/core] Mautic stored Cross-site Scripting (XSS)

items.content_html:
Mautic before 3.2.4 is affected by stored XSS. An attacker with permission to manage companies, an application feature, could attack other users, including administrators. For example, by loading an externally crafted JavaScript file, an attacker could eventually perform actions as the target user. These actions include changing the user passwords, altering user or email addresses, or adding a new administrator to the system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-35128
  • https://forum.mautic.org/c/announcements/16
  • https://forum.mautic.org/t/security-release-for-all-versions-of-mautic-prior-to-2-16-5-and-3-2-4/17786
  • https://labs.bishopfox.com/advisories/mautic-version-3.2.2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-98j2-3jv7-274m
items.title: [mautic/core] Mautic stored Cross-site Scripting (XSS)

items.content_html:
The dump function in Util/TemplateHelper.php in filp whoops before 2.1.13 has a Cross-site Scripting vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16880
  • https://github.com/filp/whoops/commit/c16791d28d1ca3139e398145f0c6565c523c291a
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2jjm-6whx-p8w4
items.title: [filp/whoops] filp whoops Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
A Stored Cross-site Scripting vulnerability has been discovered in the v5.5.0 version of the Coaster CMS product.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-17876
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/149647/Coaster-CMS-5.5.0-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-77cq-wgpf-g449
items.title: [web-feet/coastercms] Coaster CMS Stored Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in Elefant CMS before 2.0.7. There is a PHP Code Execution Vulnerability in /designer/add/stylesheet.php by using a .php extension in the New Stylesheet Name field in conjunction with <?php content, because of insufficient input validation in apps/designer/handlers/csspreview.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-16975
  • https://github.com/jbroadway/elefant/issues/286
  • https://github.com/jbroadway/elefant/commit/0795ab57c7ffa53ff4af57e229f6d9680fa54a21
  • https://github.com/jbroadway/elefant/releases/tag/elefant_2_0_7_stable
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x2w2-qgv6-8xrm
items.title: [elefant/cms] Elefant CMS PHP Code Execution Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Mautic prior to 2.1.1 fails to set flags on session cookies

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000046
  • https://www.trustmatta.com/advisories/MATTA-2017-002.txt
  • https://github.com/mautic/mautic/issues/1969
  • https://github.com/mautic/mautic/pull/2311
  • https://github.com/mautic/mautic/pull/2311/commits/f9e7981f4acf0d37fd935c9b9d5d09d7e1a49bc6
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8255-qf34-44mp
items.title: [mautic/core] Sensitive Cookie Without HttpOnly and Secure Flag

items.content_html:
nZEDb before 0.8.0.0 has XSS in the 404 error page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18286
  • https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/143725/nZEDb-0.7.3.3-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
  • https://github.com/nZEDb/nZEDb/issues/2512
  • https://github.com/nZEDb/nZEDb/pull/2513/commits/ca78b0840d98b9a09eef74ba6121a9c6143a7f44
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h847-63fg-vm6c
items.title: [nzedb/nzedb] nZEDb Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in the 404 error page

items.content_html:
XMLReader.php in PHPOffice Common before 0.2.9 allows XXE.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-14065
  • https://github.com/PHPOffice/PHPWord/issues/1421
  • https://github.com/PHPOffice/Common/pull/23
  • https://github.com/PHPOffice/Common/releases/tag/0.2.9
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2853-hf2g-9843
items.title: [phpoffice/common] PHPOffice Common Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference

items.content_html:
In Moodle 2.x and 3.x, searching of arbitrary blogs is possible because a capability check is missing.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-7490
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=352354
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9x63-m3cc-qf3g
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Unauthorized searching of arbitrary blogs by typing full url

items.content_html:
getID3() before 1.9.9, as used in ownCloud Server before 5.0.15 and 6.0.x before 6.0.2, allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files, cause a denial of service, or possibly have other impact via an XML External Entity (XXE) attack.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-2053
  • http://getid3.sourceforge.net/source/changelog.txt
  • http://secunia.com/advisories/58002
  • http://www.debian.org/security/2014/dsa-3001
  • https://github.com/JamesHeinrich/getID3/commit/afbdaa044a9a0a9dff2f800bd670e231b3ec99b2
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/james-heinrich/getid3/CVE-2014-2053.yaml
  • https://wordpress.org/news/2014/08/wordpress-3-9-2
  • http://owncloud.org/about/security/advisories/oC-SA-2014-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5v43-55m5-qr8f
items.title: [james-heinrich/getid3] getID3 is vulnerable to XML External Entity (XXE)

items.content_html:
The login form in the FriendsOfSymfony FOSUserBundle bundle before 1.3.3 for Symfony allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a long password that triggers an expensive hash computation, as demonstrated by a PBKDF2 computation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-5750
  • http://symfony.com/blog/cve-2013-5750-security-issue-in-fosuserbundle-login-form
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/friendsofsymfony/user-bundle/CVE-2013-5750.yaml
  • https://symfony.com/cve-2013-5750
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9mpf-g3fc-9rgv
items.title: [friendsofsymfony/user-bundle] FriendsOfSymfony FOSUserBundle denial of service via login form

items.content_html:
The login form in the FriendsOfSymfony FOSUserBundle bundle before 1.3.3 for Symfony allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a long password that triggers an expensive hash computation, as demonstrated by a PBKDF2 computation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-5750
  • http://symfony.com/blog/cve-2013-5750-security-issue-in-fosuserbundle-login-form
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/friendsofsymfony/user-bundle/CVE-2013-5750.yaml
  • https://symfony.com/cve-2013-5750
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9mpf-g3fc-9rgv
items.title: [friendsofsymfony/user-bundle] FriendsOfSymfony FOSUserBundle denial of service via login form

items.content_html:
A vulnerability was found in Moodle where the decompressed size of zip files was not checked against available user quota before unzipping them, which could lead to a denial of service risk. This affects versions 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4, 3.7 to 3.7.7, 3.5 to 3.5.13 and earlier unsupported versions. Fixed in 3.9.2, 3.8.5, 3.7.8 and 3.5.14.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-25630
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=410842
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-66xp-28cq-mrf2
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Denial of Service
